Like Reply  1 Reaction   2 Reactions [...] # Brace Sproul‚Äôs Post

Brace Sproul

 Report this post

üßëüíªExcited to announce Ambient Agents! Today we're releasing our first ambient agent of the week - an executive AI email assistant. This agent is built on top of a pattern we believe will be widely adopted throughout the agents released this year, and in years to come. Ambient agents are AI applications which can suggest actions to the user, then await your approval, feedback, or edits before executing the action. This pattern enables whole hosts of agent applications which would not have been fully trusted by users before, like an email assistant. Check out the free hosted executive AI email assistant here:  And the open source code here: 

122   6 Comments

Like   Comment

Ioannis Bakagiannis   11mo 

 Report this comment [...] Tomer Raitz

  + Report this post

  ü§ñ Tip: Turn Claude into your personal AI agent Most people open a new chat every time they use Claude. But there's a better way: Use Claude Projects üëá Go to  ‚Üí Projects ‚Üí Create your own agent Here's what makes it powerful: ‚úÖ Custom instructions - Tell Claude your role, preferences, and how to help you ‚úÖ Persistent files - Upload documents that give Claude context about your work ‚úÖ Memory - Each new chat in the project remembers your goals and context Example: I created a marketing expert agent with specific instructions. Each time I generate a new file or diagram, I add it to the project files. Result? The agent gets better over time because it learns from our past work together. üìà What would you use a custom Claude agent for? Drop a comment üëá

data.title: How LangChain Found a Trusted Partner for Their Sandbox Needs
data.snippet:
As a leader in open‚Äësource agent development, LangChain‚Äôs bread and butter is building, orchestrating, and deploying agents seamlessly for developers and non‚Äëtechnical users alike. To advance this mission, Brace Sproul, Head of Applied AI, and his team built a cloud‚Äëhosted coding agent that runs autonomously end to end. To open-source it reliably, they needed to nail one thing: their sandbox partner. [...] For the agent to run safely across thousands of users and complex use cases, Brace needed secure, production-level sandboxes fast and at scale. But he and his team knew from experience that building internal infrastructure drained valuable resources and engineering time. That effort was better spent enriching libraries, enhancing evals, and debugging products. So they started looking for a partner who offered a solution out of the box.

The requirements weren‚Äôt trivial. Each sandbox needed bulletproof isolation to limit access to sensitive data and fine-grained permissions to ensure protection from external attacks. And instant spin‚Äëup wasn't just a nice‚Äëto‚Äëhave. Any delays could impact user engagement and break agent workflows. [...] #### If anybody asked me which runtime platform to use, I'm going to 100% say Daytona every time. With their SDK, we never have to worry about an agent leaking or taking actions that it shouldn't. I haven't seen this anywhere else.

Brace Sproul

Head of Applied AI at LangChain

###### MORE CUSTOMER STORIES

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

##### How Stanford‚Äôs CS Department Accelerates Open-Source Agent Development With Daytona

data.title: Introducing Open Source Deep Research Agent - LinkedIn
data.snippet:
# Introducing Open Source Deep Research Agent

This title was summarized by AI from the post below.

Brace Sproul

 Report this post

OPEN DEEP RESEARCH!!! We're extremely excited to release our open source deep research agent! This agent excels at high quality research and report generation over not only web searches, but also internal data sources!! Along with the repo, we've also released a blog post diving into the architecture, design decisions, and lessons we learned while building it. Check out the repo, blog, YouTube video, and demo on Open Agent Platform today: OSS Repo:  Blog:  Video:  Open Agent Platform demo:

Open Deep Research is here üîç We've open sourced one of the most powerful agent use cases. Built on LangGraph, Open Deep Research: ‚Ä¢ Uses a supervisor architecture to coordinate research sub-agents ‚Ä¢ Supports your own LLMs, tools, and MCP servers ‚Ä¢ Produces high-quality reports with scoped, iterative deep research Whether you're comparing products or digging deep into a topic ‚Äî Open Deep Research adapts to the task. üìπ Watch an overview on Youtube:  üìñ Learn more in our blog:  üëã Try it out on Open Agent Platform:  üë©üíª Check out the code:

## Repository files navigation

# Awesome LangGraph.js

A collection of open source projects and applications built using LangGraph.js. Also, a list of YouTube videos and tutorials covering LangGraph.js.

Note

Have your own open source project/video and want it added to this list? See the Contributing section below.

# Open Source Projects

## By the LangChain Team [...] LangGraph Generative UI Examples - A collection of generative UI examples using LangGraph.js
 Generative UI Computer Use Agent - A full-stack application for interacting with computer use agents (CUA) via a generative UI interface with LangGraph.js.
 LangGraph.js Examples - A collection of example applications and workflows built using LangGraph.js. (Basic RAG Graph, Human-in-the-Loop, Stockbroker Generative UI, Streaming Messages Fullstack Application)
 Site RAG - A Chrome extension built with LangGraph.js for preforming question answering on any website.
 Fully Local PDF Chatbot - A full-stack local chatbot application for interacting with PDF documents.
 Chat LangChain.js - A RAG chat application for asking questions over the LangChain documentation.
